description:
nova.compute.api.HostAPI.host_power_action needs to be added to nova.compute.cells_api

At the moment if you have a host in a different cell to your api server, you can't call host_power_action on it.
title: host_power_action doesn't work in cells

comments.content:
nova.compute.api.HostAPI.host_power_action needs to be added to nova.compute.cells_api

At the moment if you have a host in a different cell to your api server, you can't call host_power_action on it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~msherborne+openstack

comments.content: Turns out this is not a bug.  There's a bit of trickery in cells_api's version of HostAPI() in that unimplemented methods there use api.py's HostAPI() versions of methods.... and the rpcapi class is swapped out for one that proxies via cells to the correct cell and manager.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens
